attributes.action: Change Free Childcare eligibility to parents combined income
attributes.additional_details: It’s not exactly fair that two parents can earn £99k taxable income each, earning £198k and still get government support. But to the other extreme one parent earning £101k and the other on £20k does not
attributes.background: Currently you can only get tax-free and free childcare if a single parent earns less than £100k taxable income. It should be household income.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action: 

Make all households with income under £200,000 eligible for free childcare
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/709230
